covid-19 in South Korea

This blog will introduce the COVID-19 situation in South Korea

Sen Wang true
09-11-2020

Introduction

Coronavirus is an infectious coronavirus from Wuhan, China. With cities quarantined and hospitals overwhelmed, the new virus has caused panic in many countries. This blog will analyze the Coronavirus situation in Korea

Data description

This dataset comes from the report materials of KCDC and local governments.

There are 14 vars and 5165 obs in the dataset. The variables explain:

patient_id - the ID of the patient (n-th confirmed patient)

sex - the sex of the patient

age - the age group of the patient

country - the country of the patient

province - the province of the patient

city - the city of the patient

infection_case - the case of infection

infected_by - the ID of who has infected the patient

contact_number - the number of contacts with people

symptom_onset_date - the date of symptom onset

confirmed_date - the date of confirmation

released_date - the date of discharge

deceased_date - the date of decease

state - isolated / released / deceased

Analysis

Number of new confirmed people

According to the Figure 1, at the beginning we look at the number of new cases over time. The first case was detected on January 20. The jump will occur around February 20, where a large number of cases are detected each day. Mostly, it was detected on March 1 - almost 1,000. After this time, the number of detected cases decreased. In April no more than 30 new cases were recorded per day (usually no more than 10). Another jump occurred at the turn of May and June (the highest value in this period was observed on May 27 and amounted to 76 cases in one day), which resulted in the restoration of some restrictions.

Figure 1: Number of new confirmed people

Number of confirmed people

According to the Figure 2, We can find that the vast majority of infected people come from these three places including Seoul, Gyeongsangbuk-do, Gyeonggi-do, and the number of people in other places is much smaller than them. Even Incheon, the fourth most infected place, is only a quarter of Gyeonggi-do.

Figure 2: Region where infection was detected

Conclusion

By the end of February, the number of new infected in Korea was growing rapidly, but since then the number of new cases has been decreasing day by day.

The infections are most often found in the Seoul.

Packages

Thanks for the providers of these packages used as follows:

  • ggplot2 (Wickham 2016)

  • tidyverse (Wickham et al. 2019)

  • plotly (Sievert 2020)

Sievert, Carson. 2020. Interactive Web-Based Data Visualization with R, Plotly, and Shiny. Chapman; Hall/CRC. https://plotly-r.com.

Wickham, Hadley. 2016. Ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis. Springer-Verlag New York. https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org.

Wickham, Hadley, Mara Averick, Jennifer Bryan, Winston Chang, Lucy D’Agostino McGowan, Romain François, Garrett Grolemund, et al. 2019. “Welcome to the tidyverse.” Journal of Open Source Software 4 (43): 1686. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.01686.
